# Build Tabulae datasets

```
#| echo: false
#| output: false
repo = pwd() |> dirname |> dirname
summariesdir = joinpath(repo, "summaries")
tranchenames = filter(readdir(summariesdir)) do dir
    startswith(dir, "tranche")
end
tranchepaths = map(name -> joinpath(summariesdir, name), tranchenames)
length(tranchepaths)
```


::: {.callout-caution title="Content TBA"}

- orthographies.

## Start from named tuple data

You can build Tabulae datasets from the named tuple reading of ChatGPT summaries of Lewis-Short articles. See [this tutorial](./readsummaries.qmd)
```
#| warning: false
#| output: false
using LexiconMining
(data, errs) = readdata(tranchepaths)
```

## Extrapolate morphology

- specific to each PoS 


```
#| warning: false
lsnouns = nouns(data)
```

## Translate morphological objects to Tabulae tables

```
nounscex = cextable(lsnouns)
```

```
#| warning: false
nounscexlines = tabulaecex.(lsnouns)
```

We now have a bazillion lines of in tabulae format.
